I write these things to you because I cannot rest. I feel that you are in danger of losing eternal life through the many perplexities and cares that overwhelm you in this life. Arise and shine, I beseech you, before your light shall go out in darkness. I shall meet these warnings given to you in the day of God, and you also will meet them again.--Letter 30, 1888. 

Ellen G. White Estate Washington, D. C. Jan. 22, 1988. Entire Letter.
